trans-unit.source: Defines identifiers that indicate the type of a selection.

Components of a designer document can be selected using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ISelectionService.SetSelectedComponents%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ISelectionService>.
Some types of actions can operate on a selected component or group of selected components.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ISelectionService> keeps track of the selection type of the current selection.

These selection type identifiers indicate whether the selection was completed using a single click, a mouse down or mouse up selection, whether the selection should replace the previous selection, or use the default selection mode.

Use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes> enumeration to specify the type of a selection when setting a new selection using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ISelectionService.SetSelectedComponents%2A> method.
Represents an add selection that adds the selected components to the current selection, maintaining the current set of selected components.
Represents a regular selection.
The selection service responds to the CTRL and SHIFT keys to support adding or removing components to or from the selection.
Represents a selection that occurs when a user clicks a component.
If the newly selected component is already selected, it is promoted to be the primary selected component rather than being canceled.
Represents a selection that occurs when the user presses on the mouse button while the mouse pointer is over a component.
If the component under the pointer is already selected, it is promoted to become the primary selected component rather than being canceled.
Represents a selection that occurs when the user releases the mouse button immediately after a component has been selected.
If the newly selected component is already selected, it is promoted to be the primary selected component rather than being canceled.
Represents a regular selection.
The selection service responds to the CTRL and SHIFT keys to support adding or removing components to or from the selection.
Represents a primary selection that occurs when a user clicks on a component.
If a component in the selection list is already selected, the component is promoted to be the primary selection.
Represents a remove selection that removes the selected components from the current selection, maintaining the current set of selected components.
Represents a selection that occurs when the content of a selection is replaced.
The selection service replaces the current selection with the replacement.
Represents a toggle selection that switches between the current selection and the provided selection.

If a component is already selected and is passed into <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.ISelectionService.SetSelectedComponents*"></xref> with a selection type of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes.Toggle"></xref>, the component selection will be canceled.

Identifies the valid selection types as <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes.Normal"></xref>, <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes.Replace"></xref>, <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes.MouseDown"></xref>, <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes.MouseUp"></xref>, or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.SelectionTypes.Click"></xref>.
